books/assets/canvas/kirkus-reviews-the-u.title: Kirkus Reviews - the Unbearable lightness of being
books/assets/canvas/kirkus-reviews-the-u.description: "Unbearable Lightness of Being" by Milan Kundera is a profoundly insightful novel that delves into the intricate nuances of love, politics, and existential dilemmas. Set against the backdrop of the 1968 Prague Spring and its subsequent Soviet-led invasion, the story primarily follows the lives of Tomas, a surgeon and a philanderer, and Tereza, his wife and a photographer, along with other central characters like Sabina, Tomas's mistress, and Franz, her lover.Kundera masterfully explores the dichotomy of lightness and weight, a central theme of the novel. This philosophical concept questions whether life is a fleeting, insignificant occurrence (lightness) or a series of meaningful events and responsibilities (weight). Through his characters, Kundera examines how each approach impacts one's existence and relationships.The novel is also remarkable for its exploration of political and historical contexts, particularly the impact of Czechoslovakia's political turmoil on its citizens. It provides a poignant commentary on how external political forces can intrude into and shape personal lives, relationships, and moral decisions.Moreover, Kundera's narrative style, characterized by its introspective and often non-linear approach, invites readers to engage deeply with the characters' psychological landscapes. This introspection is balanced with moments of irony and humor, making the novel as intellectually stimulating as it is emotionally resonant.In terms of its impact on literature and culture, "The Unbearable Lightness of Being" stands out for its philosophical depth, its innovative narrative structure, and its profound exploration of human emotions and the existential plight. It remains a vital read for anyone interested in the intersections of love, personal freedom, and the inescapable influence of historical and political contexts on human life.https://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/milan-kundera/the-unbearable-lightness-of-being/

self-management/lyt's-epic-life-audit-te.title: LYT's Epic Life Audit Template
self-management/lyt's-epic-life-audit-te.description: Add a link up to your home note, or "personal retreat" note or "life compass" note or similar. This epic life audit is a powerful way to gain perspective on your life and realign your efforts to live with more meaning and intention. What you need. A private place. A thinking space. Prepare yourself beforehand. Ideally a few days prior, just start thinking loosely about where you are in life and how things are going. Budget 2-3 hours of private, uninterrupted time. Or 3 time blocks of 30-45 minutes. Result you'll say afterwards: I know exactly where I am, I know how I got here, and I know where I would like to go. Result you'll feel afterwards: Deeply knowing whatever it is you care about, and how you want to move forward. How to go through it: Don't score based on outcomes, but on alignment. From the bottom...up! Reasoning for Overall Score Two hours later, your final reflections will go here. Next actions and takeaways Try to give yourself 4-8 high-level actions and takeaways. Below is an example: Live a lifestyle with movement & vitality: Significantly change my current lifestyle from a sedentary one, back to one with movement and vitality. Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the sections on Recreation, Environment, and Body, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Hobbies, Travel, Leisure, Consuming, and Experiences, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Hobbies: Current = x | Ideal = x Travel: Current = x | Ideal = x Leisure: Current = x | Ideal = x Consuming: Current = x | Ideal = x Experiences: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Physical Environment and Sensory Experience, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Physical Environment: Current = x | Ideal = x Sensory Experience: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Sleep, Nutrition, Movement, and Exercise, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Sleep: Current = x | Ideal = x Nutrition: Current = x | Ideal = x Movement: Current = x | Ideal = x Exercise: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the sections on Soul, Partnership, Family and Friends, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Life Purpose and Spirituality, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Life Purpose & Personal Legend & Personal Discovery: Current = x | Ideal = x Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Tortor aliquam nulla facilisi cras fermentum odio eu feugiat pretium. Leo a diam sollicitudin tempor id eu nisl. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do. Spirituality: Current = x | Ideal = x Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Intimacy & Closeness, Romance, and Fun & Lightness, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Intimacy & Closeness: Current = x | Ideal = x Romance: Current = x | Ideal = x Fun & Lightness: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Family Connection and Family Health, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Family Connection: Current = x | Ideal = x Family Health: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Close Friends, Old Friends, Community & Social Connections, and Friends that are Protemoi, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Close Friends: Current = x | Ideal = x Old Friends: Current = x | Ideal = x Community & Social Connections: Current = x | Ideal = x Friends that are Protemoi: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the sections on Work, Finances and Mind, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Career/Business Health & Trajectory, Protemoi Relationships, Creation/Production, and Sense of Contribution, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Career/Business Health & Trajectory: Current = x | Ideal = x Protemoi Relationships: Current = x | Ideal = x Creation/Production: Current = x | Ideal = x Sense of Contribution: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Net Worth, Cash Flow, Sense of Control & Confidence, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Net Worth: Current = x | Ideal = x Cash Flow: Current = x | Ideal = x Sense of Control & Confidence: Current = x | Ideal = x Reasoning for Overall Score After finishing the subsections on Sense of Learning, Sense of Sensemaking, and Sense of Personal Growth, then roll up your takeaways into a paragraph here. Sense of Learning: Current = x | Ideal = x Sense of Sensemaking: Current = x | Ideal = x Sense of Personal Growth: Current = x | Ideal = x Be kind to yourself. Be kind by being honest with yourself. The hidden benefit to this exercise isn't the score, it's the hidden emotions and deeper understandings that bubble up. It's the clarity and confidence the exercise creates. Best of luck to you, Nick If you want help setting up your own thinking space, learn more here.

achProcessCol = 1 To UBound(achProcessArray, 1) If achProcessArray(achProcessCol, 1) = dataArray(i, typeCol) Then newWs.Cells(newRow, 12).Value = achProcessArray(achProcessCol, 2) ' Assign AchProcess Exit For End If Next achProcessCol ' Generate W/O po = dataArray(i, 5) ' Assuming P/O is in the 6th column pn = dataArray(i, 6) ' Assuming PN is in the 7th column wo = po & Left(pn, 3) & Right(pn, 5) newWs.Cells(newRow, 13).Value = wo ' Assign W/O newRow = newRow + 1 planId = planId + 1 ' Increment Plan ID End If Next j Next i newWs.Columns("I:I").Select Selection.NumberFormat = "yyyy-mm-dd" Private Sub HandleColumnCopy(ws As Worksheet, columnName As String, targetCol As String, Optional width As Integer = 0) Dim find As Range Set find = ws.Rows(1).find(columnName, LookIn:=xlValues, LookAt:=xlWhole) If Not find Is Nothing Then ws.columns(targetCol).Insert Shift:=xlToRight find.EntireColumn.Cut destination:=ws.columns(targetCol) Application.CutCopyMode = False If width > 0 Then ws.columns(targetCol).ColumnWidth = width Else MsgBox "Column '" & columnName & "' not found!", vbExclamation, "Error" End If End Sub

Function FindParentRow(ws As Worksheet, colName As String, searchValue As String, ByRef parentLevel As Long) As Long Dim i As Long For i = 2 To ws.Cells(ws.Rows.count, colName).End(xlUp).Row If ws.Cells(i, colName).value = searchValue Then parentLevel = ws.Cells(i, "L").value FindParentRow = i Exit Function End If Next i FindParentRow = 0

ì´ì œ ë‹¨ê³„ë³„ë¡œ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ì‘ì„±í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤:import numpy as np
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from scipy.stats import norm
from sqlalchemy import create_engine
import urllib.parse
import pandas as pd

import dash

import time # ë°ì´í„°ë² ì´ìŠ¤ ì ‘ì† ì •ë³´ ì„¤ì •
username = urllib.parse.quote_plus('test')

app = dash.Dash(__name__) # ì‹¤ì‹œê°„ ë°ì´í„° ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ í•¨ìˆ˜
def load_data(): query = "SELECT * FROM production_data" # í…Œì´ë¸”ì˜ ì´ë¦„ df = pd.read_sql(query, engine) return df # ë ˆì´ì•„ì›ƒ ì„¤ì •
app.layout = html.Div([ html.H1("WP Pouch Production Dashboard), # ë‚ ì§œ í•„í„° dcc.DatePickerRange( id='date-picker', start_date=pd.Timestamp.today().floor('D') - pd.DateOffset(months=1), end_date=pd.Timestamp.today().floor('D'), display_format='YYYY-MM-DD' ), # ì°¨íŠ¸ë“¤ html.Div([ dcc.Graph(id='production-chart'), dcc.Graph(id='defect-rate-chart') ], style={'display': 'flex', 'flex-direction': 'row'}), html.Div([ dcc.Graph(id='cpk-chart') ], style={'display': 'flex', 'flex-direction': 'row'})
]) # ë°ì´í„° ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ ë° ì°¨íŠ¸ ìƒì„± ì½œë°±

)

Cpk ì°¨íŠ¸ cpk_chart = create_cpk_chart(filtered_df) return production_chart, defect_rate_chart, cpk_chart # ì°¨íŠ¸ ìƒì„± í•¨ìˆ˜ë“¤ (ì•„ë˜ì—ì„œ êµ¬í˜„)
def create_production_chart(df): df['is_ng'] = df['cell_assy_ok_ng'] == 'NG' production_summary = df.groupby('date_column').agg( production_count=('id', 'count'), defect_count=('is_ng', 'sum') ).reset_index() production_summary['good_count'] = production_summary['production_count'] - production_summary['defect_count'] fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Bar( x=production_summary['date_column'], y=production_summary['good_count'], name='Good', marker_color='blue' )) fig.add_trace(go.Bar( x=production_summary['date_column'], y=production_summary['defect_count'], name='NG', marker_color='red' )) fig.update_layout( title="Production Chart (Good vs NG)", barmode='stack' ) return fig
def create_defect_rate_chart(df): df['is_ng'] = df['cell_assy_ok_ng'] == 'NG' production_summary = df.groupby('date_column').agg( production_count=('id', 'count'), defect_count=('is_ng', 'sum') ).reset_index() production_summary['defect_rate'] = (production_summary['defect_count'] / production_summary['production_count']) * 100 fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Scatter( x=production_summary['date_column'], y=production_summary['defect_rate'], mode='lines+markers', name='ë¶ˆëŸ‰ìœ¨' )) fig.update_layout( title="ë¶ˆëŸ‰ìœ¨ (%)", yaxis_title="ë¶ˆëŸ‰ìœ¨ (%)" ) return fig
def create_cpk_chart(df): df['temp_diff'] = abs(df['preheater_current_temp'] - df['preheater_setting_temp']) mean_temp = df['preheater_current_temp'].mean() sigma_temp = df['preheater_current_temp'].std() usl = df['preheater_setting_temp'].mean() * 1.05 lsl = df['preheater_setting_temp'].mean() * 0.95 fig = go.Figure() # ë¶„í¬ ê³¡ì„  x = np.linspace(mean_temp - 4 * sigma_temp, mean_temp + 4 * sigma_temp, 100) y = norm.pdf(x, mean_temp, sigma_temp) fig.add_trace(go.Scatter( x=x, y=y, mode='lines', name='Current Temperature Distribution', line=dict(color='blue') )) # USL, LSL, ì¤‘ì•™ê°’ fig.add_shape(type='line', x0=lsl, x1=lsl, y0=0, y1=max(y), line=dict(color='red', dash='dash')) fig.add_shape(type='line', x0=usl, x1=usl, y0=0, y1=max(y), line=dict(color='red', dash='dash')) fig.add_shape(type='line', x0=mean_temp, x1=mean_temp, y0=0, y1=max(y), line=dict(color='green', dash='dash')) fig.update_layout( title="Cpk ê·¸ë˜í”„", xaxis_title="í”„ë¦¬íˆí„° ì˜¨ë„", yaxis_title="ë°€ë„", ) return fig
# 1ë¶„ë§ˆë‹¤ ë°ì´í„° ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸

)

)

works/2024-02-05-question-of-hq.html.title: 2024-02-05 Question of HQ
works/2024-02-05-question-of-hq.html.description: Question: Are the rack and container assembly instructions currently available in multiple languages, including Chinese, or do they require translation? Answer: The assembly instructions are currently only available in Korean. We recognize the importance of making these accessible to our team in China and plan to have them translated into English as an intermediary step. This process is expected to take approximately one week. We will explore options for translation into Chinese to ensure clarity and accessibility for all team members involved in the assembly process. Question: Do we have visual aids, such as videos, to supplement the assembly instructions? Answer: At the moment, we do not have video documentation of the assembly process. However, we acknowledge the value of visual aids in enhancing understanding and reducing the potential for errors. We will initiate the creation of video tutorials that detail the assembly process, ensuring that these resources are comprehensive and easy to follow. Question: What specific assembly procedures are currently undertaken by the Korean CM, and are we fully aware of these processes? Answer: The Korean CM handles a range of assembly procedures that are documented in our standard operating procedures. However, it's essential to conduct a thorough review to ensure that all processes are fully captured and up-to-date. We are in the process of auditing these procedures to confirm their completeness and accuracy. Question: Considering the assembly procedures performed by the Korean CM, do we believe it's feasible to replicate these processes in China without significant obstacles? Answer: Based on our initial assessment, we believe that transitioning these assembly processes to China is feasible. The procedures do not require specialized skills that cannot be replicated or taught in China. However, we must ensure that all procedural documentation is current, translated, and adapted as necessary to meet any local regulatory requirements or operational differences. Question: Are there any anticipated challenges or limitations in transferring the assembly line to China, such as differences in regulations, standards, or workforce skills? Answer: While we anticipate a smooth transition overall, we are mindful of potential challenges such as differences in regulatory standards, the need for workforce training, and the adaptation of procedures to local practices. We are committed to conducting a detailed analysis to identify any such challenges early in the process and develop strategies to address them effectively. Question: What will be the approach if there are questions raised during the meeting that cannot be immediately answered? Answer: Should any questions arise that I cannot answer directly, I will take detailed notes and follow up with my direct manager to ensure a timely and accurate response. We are committed to transparency and effective communication throughout this transition process. It's clear from your preparation that while there are areas needing attention, such as the translation of documentation and the creation of visual aids, you have a proactive plan to address these needs. Emphasizing your commitment to a thorough review and update of assembly procedures, along with a strategic approach to overcoming potential challenges, will be key to reassuring the executives of the feasibility and readiness for the transition.Youcan you make it little bit easier? my mother tongue is korean, so some of that sentences are hard to memorize for me.ChatGPTChatGPTCertainly! Let's simplify the responses for your meeting: Question: Do we need to translate the assembly instructions? Are there videos? Answer: Yes, the instructions are only in Korean now. We need to translate them into English, which will take about a week. We don't have videos yet, but we plan to make them to help everyone understand the process better. Question: Can we use the same assembly procedures in China as in Korea? Answer: The procedures we use in Korea can be used in China too. We don't see big problems with moving the assembly there. Most tasks don't need special skills. But, we need to update and translate our instructions to make sure everyone can follow them. Question: What problems might we face moving to China? Answer: We might face some challenges, like different rules or the need to train the team in China. But we believe we can handle these by planning well and updating our instructions. Question: How long will it take to get all the documentation ready for the China team? Answer: We need about one week to translate the current documents into English. Making videos and further translations might take a bit more time. Question: Will the training materials be understandable for someone who doesn't speak Korean? Answer: Yes, we will translate everything into English first, and then into Chinese if needed, to make sure everyone can understand. Question: How do we ensure the quality of the assembly process remains high after moving to China? Answer: We will train the China team using our updated guides and videos. We will also check the assembly quality regularly. Question: Are there any parts of the assembly that must stay in Korea? Answer: Right now, we think everything can move to China. But we will double-check to make sure. Question: What is our timeline for moving the assembly line to China? Answer: We are still planning, but we will share a timeline as soon as we have it. Question: How will we handle differences in work culture between Korea and China? Answer: We will learn about the work culture in China and adapt our training and management to fit well with the team there. Question: Do we need any special permissions or certifications to start manufacturing in China? Answer: We are checking on this. We will get all the needed permissions and certifications before we start. Question: How will we transfer equipment and materials to China? Answer: We are planning the best way to do this. We will make sure everything is safe and cost-effective. Question: What if we face unexpected challenges during the move? Answer: We will plan carefully and have backup plans. We will solve problems as they come. Question: How will we communicate with the team in China? Answer: We will use English for official communication. We might also use translators when needed to make sure everyone understands. Question: Will there be ongoing support from Korea to the China team? Answer: Yes, we will keep supporting the China team. We can have regular meetings and visits to make sure everything goes well. Question: How will this move affect our delivery times to customers? Answer: We plan to keep delivery times the same, or even improve them by being closer to some of our customers.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_siteName.description: The name of the vault / exported site

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
